com.esri.mo2.ui.dlg
Class MessageBox

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.ui.dlg.MessageBox
public class MessageBox
extends Object

Displays a modal popup Message Dialog in a separate Thread. Implements the approach provided by ModalPopUpLauncher to provide simple message displays similar to those provided by javax.swing.JOptionPane.

See Also:
ModalPopUpLauncher, JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component, java.lang.Object)

Method Summary
static void showMessageDialog(Component parentComponent, Object message)
          Displays a modal information-message dialog titled "Confirm".
static void showMessageDialog(Component parentComponent, Object message, String title, int messageType)
          Displays a message dialog using a default icon determined by the messageType parameter.

Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

showMessageDialog

public static void showMessageDialog(Component parentComponent,
                                     Object message)
Displays a modal information-message dialog titled "Confirm". Parameters are the same as for JOptionPane.showMessageDialog except that there is no need to specify a parent Component - null is used instead.

Parameters:
parentComponent - defines the Component that is to be the parent of this dialog box
message - a descriptive message to be placed in the dialog box
See Also:
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component,Object message,String,int)

showMessageDialog

public static void showMessageDialog(Component parentComponent,
                                     Object message,
                                     String title,
                                     int messageType)
Displays a message dialog using a default icon determined by the messageType parameter.

Parameters:
parentComponent - defines the Component that is to be the parent of this dialog box
message - a descriptive message to be placed in the dialog box
title - the title for the dialog box
messageType - defines the style of the message. The possible values are:
  • ERROR_MESSAGE
  • INFORMATION_MESSAGE
  • WARNING_MESSAGE
  • QUESTION_MESSAGE
  • PLAIN_MESSAGE
See Also:
showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component,Object message)

showMessageDialog

public static void showMessageDialog(Component parentComponent,
                                     Object message,
                                     String title,
                                     int messageType,
                                     Icon icon)
Displays a message dialog with the specified parameters. Refer JOptionPane.showMessageDialog for a detailed description of the parameters.

Parameters:
parentComponent - defines the Component that is to be the parent of this dialog box
message - a descriptive message to be placed in the dialog box
title - the title for the dialog box
messageType - defines the style of the message. The possible values are:
  • ERROR_MESSAGE
  • INFORMATION_MESSAGE
  • WARNING_MESSAGE
  • QUESTION_MESSAGE
  • PLAIN_MESSAGE
icon - A representative icon to be placed in the dialog box. A default value for this is determined by the messageType parameter.
See Also:
showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component,Object message)
